> [nofish](#comment_183_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Sounds like a good idea, I need some more time to thing about it, but sounds doable. I just did a quick test compressing ZeroTalk user files:
> 
> Raw, separate files: 7.6MB
> tar: 12MB (hm)
> zip: 4.8MB
> tar.gz: 3.1MB
> tar.bz2: 2.4MB
> tar.zstandard: 2.1MB
> tar.brotli: 2.0MB
> tar.xz: 1.9MB

Try [lzip](http://www.nongnu.org/lzip/) too, its author is really anal about replacing xz with lzip, and has a few really good points in doing so. Also good compression and often a bit faster compared to xz.

> [deviated](#comment_1_1EtYRBug7gbtGWYtvfhfGhfEEEEiH9fn5L): ZeroNet, for Me, is all about running my website with no cost.

Well _technically_ you are running your website on others' expense, using their bandwidth and disk storage space. At least this is not a scam convincing you to lease your storage in exchange of valuable malware using you as a spam zombie.

Which reminds me: when will we get spammers abusing the net?

> [deviated](#comment_2_1EtYRBug7gbtGWYtvfhfGhfEEEEiH9fn5L): I don't get your point, would you explain what you mean?

"No cost" for you is paid by others. TANSTAAFL.
